sentence.Network_en: I don't react anymore when opponents try to niggle me.
sentence.Network_cn: 对手找茬惹我时，我不会再理他们。

sentence.Network_en: Our lawyers will niggle over every little detail of the case.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的律师们会就这个案件的每一个细节进行辩论.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'do something in a fiddling or ineffectual way'): apparently of Scandinavian origin; compare with Norwegian nigla. Current senses date from the late 18th cent

entry.def: If something niggles you, it causes you to worry slightly over a long period of time.

example.ex: I realise now that the things which used to niggle and annoy me just don't really matter...
example.tran: 我现在意识到那些曾令我烦恼不快的事情其实无关紧要。

example.ex: It's been niggling at my mind ever since I met Neville in Nice...
example.tran: 自从在尼斯见到内维尔后，我一直忐忑不安。

entry.def: If someone niggles you, they annoy you by continually criticizing you for what you think are small or unimportant things.

example.ex: I don't react anymore when opponents try to niggle me...
example.tran: 对手找茬惹我时，我不会再理他们。

example.ex: You tend to niggle at your partner, and get hurt when he doesn't hug you.
example.tran: 你往往会对伴侣吹毛求疵，如果他不拥抱你，就感到受了伤害。

sentences.sentence: "don't fuss too much over the grandchildren--they are quite big now"

auth_sentence.content: Sometimes they kick you, niggle and try some time-wasting.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sometimes they kick you, niggle and try some time-wasting.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sometimes they kick you, niggle and try some time-wasting.

auth_sentence.content: Down the hill, Geraghty was starting to niggle but he knew his mount would stay better than the rest.
auth_sentence.res_content: Down the hill, Geraghty was starting to niggle but he knew his mount would stay better than the rest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Down the hill, Geraghty was starting to niggle but he knew his mount would stay better than the rest.

auth_sentence.content: I was second after the first day, but the vague niggle I'd had beforehand was getting worse.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was second after the first day, but the vague niggle I'd had beforehand was getting worse.
